title: 441-C
statement: C. Valera and Tubestime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutValera has got a rectangle table consisting ofnrows andmcolumns. Valera numbered the table rows starting from one, from top to bottom and the columns – starting from one, from left to right. We will represent cell that is on the intersection of rowxand columnyby a pair of integers(x,y).Valera wants to place exactlyktubes on his rectangle table. A tube is such sequence of table cells(x1,y1),(x2,y2),...,(xr,yr), that:r≥ 2;for any integeri(1 ≤i≤r- 1)the following equation|xi-xi+ 1| + |yi-yi+ 1| = 1holds;each table cell, which belongs to the tube, must occur exactly once in the sequence.Valera thinks that the tubes are arranged in a fancy manner if the following conditions are fulfilled:no pair of tubes has common cells;each cell of the table belongs to some tube.Help Valera to arrangektubes on his rectangle table in a fancy manner.InputThe first line contains three space-separated integersn,m,k(2 ≤n,m≤ 300;2 ≤ 2k≤n·m) — the number of rows, the number of columns and the number of tubes, correspondingly.OutputPrintklines. In thei-th line print the description of thei-th tube: first print integerri(the number of tube cells), then print2riintegersxi1,yi1,xi2,yi2, ...,xiri,yiri(the sequence of table cells).If there are multiple solutions, you can print any of them. It is guaranteed that at least one solution exists.ExamplesInput3 3 3Output3 1 1 1 2 1 33 2 1 2 2 2 33 3 1 3 2 3 3Input2 3 1Output6 1 1 1 2 1 3 2 3 2 2 2 1NotePicture for the first sample:Picture for the second sample:

processed.result:
You are given a rectangular grid with $n$ rows and $m$ columns. You need to place $k$ tubes on the grid. A tube is a sequence of cells where each cell is connected to the next cell in the sequence either horizontally or vertically.  

Here are the rules:

* Each tube must have at least 2 cells.
* No two tubes can share any cells.
* Every cell on the grid must belong to exactly one tube.

Find one way to place the tubes on the grid that satisfies these rules.

Output the description of each tube as a line with the number of cells in the tube followed by the coordinates of each cell in the tube.

You are given a rectangular grid. You need to place a specific number of "tubes" on the grid. Each tube is a sequence of connected cells where each cell is exactly one step away from the next cell (horizontally or vertically).  No two tubes can share cells, and every cell on the grid must be part of a tube.  Output the placement of each tube.
